title: Tove

| A tove:* has no hands.
* is an [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* wanders randomly.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* does not appear in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom").
* cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming"). |                    |

**Toves** are a new type of "Jabberwockian" that can be encountered in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"). On every move, they have a 5% chance of digging a [pit](/wiki/Pit "Pit") in the ground ("The tove gyres and gimbles into the ground"). If a tove digs in a square that already contains a pit, it creates a [hole](/wiki/Hole "Hole") and falls through to the next level. Toves can only dig downward; they cannot [tunnel](/wiki/Tunnel "Tunnel") through walls. They are immune to grab and swallowing attacks.

Toves are a valid polymorph form. A player polymorphed into a tove can dig with #[monster](/wiki/Monster_\(command\) "Monster (command)"), is immune to grab and swallowing attacks, and can also quickly open tins without a tin opener.

Contrary to their encyclopedia entry and source material, toves are not [slithy](/wiki/Slithy "Slithy").

'Twas brillig, and the slithy toves  
Did gyre and gimble in the wabe;  
All mimsy were the borogoves,  
And the mome raths outgrabe.

Jabberwocky, by Lewis Carroll
html:
Tove

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
J tove
Difficulty 11
Attacks Bite 1d10 physical
J tove
Difficulty 11
Attacks

Bite 1d10 physical

Base level 10
Base experience 211
Speed 10
Base AC 4
Base MR 50
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 300
Nutritional value 50
Size small

A tove:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is omnivorous.
  • wanders randomly.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • does not appear in Gehennom.
  • cannot be tamed.

Toves are a new type of "Jabberwockian" that can be encountered in dNetHack. On every move, they have a 5% chance of digging a pit in the ground ("The tove gyres and gimbles into the ground"). If a tove digs in a square that already contains a pit, it creates a hole and falls through to the next level. Toves can only dig downward; they cannot tunnel through walls. They are immune to grab and swallowing attacks.

Toves are a valid polymorph form. A player polymorphed into a tove can dig with #monster, is immune to grab and swallowing attacks, and can also quickly open tins without a tin opener.

Contrary to their encyclopedia entry and source material, toves are not slithy.

'Twas brillig, and the slithy toves
Did gyre and gimble in the wabe;
All mimsy were the borogoves,
And the mome raths outgrabe.

Jabberwocky, by Lewis Carroll

'''Toves''' are a new type of "Jabberwockian" that can be encountered in [[dNetHack]]. On every move, they have a 5% chance of digging a [[pit]] in the ground ("The tove gyres and gimbles into the ground"). If a tove digs in a square that already contains a pit, it creates a [[hole]] and falls through to the next level. Toves can only dig downward; they cannot [[tunnel]] through walls. They are immune to grab and swallowing attacks.

Toves are a valid polymorph form.  A player polymorphed into a tove can dig with #[[Monster (command)|monster]], is immune to grab and swallowing attacks, and can also quickly open tins without a tin opener.

Contrary to their encyclopedia entry and source material, toves are not [[slithy]].

	All mimsy were the borogoves,
	And the mome raths outgrabe.
